page.title: 07ST MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: In 1888 St.Mary's Church,Atherstone was dedicated by the Bishop of Worcester, having been rebuilt on the old site in 1848-50.Originally the Augustinian Friars had built the church in the late 14c on land granted by the Prior of Merevale.By 1385 they had finished a small church and the present chancel. Up until 1884 the nave and chancel had been separated by a walk-through and were linked only after the latter had been refurbished,at a cost of 3,500 pounds which meant that 1,400 people could be seated to cater for an increased Victorian population.Church and Free Grammar School played dual roles on the same site and existed for 300 years.Throughout 1985 further restoration work has been undertaken with the construction of a Family Centre and Coffee Lounge.
